title: Loop Control
subtitle: Break and Continue
description:
# Controlling Loop Flow

## Break - Exit Early

`break` stops the loop immediately:

```gdscript
for i in range(10):
    if i == 5:
        break
    print(i)  # 0, 1, 2, 3, 4
```

## Continue - Skip Iteration

`continue` skips to the next iteration:

```gdscript
for i in range(5):
    if i == 2:
        continue
    print(i)  # 0, 1, 3, 4 (skips 2)
```

## Practical Example

```gdscript
var enemies = ["goblin", "empty", "orc", "boss", "slime"]

for enemy in enemies:
    if enemy == "empty":
        continue  # Skip empty spaces
    if enemy == "boss":
        print("Found boss!")
        break  # Stop searching
    print("Fighting ", enemy)
```

## Your Quest

Use break and continue in game systems.

solutionCode:
# Loop Control Challenge

# 1. Search for treasure in chests
var chests = ["empty", "gold", "empty", "treasure", "empty"]
print("Searching chests...")
for chest in chests:
    if chest == "empty":
        print("Empty chest, continue searching...")
        continue
    if chest == "treasure":
        print("TREASURE FOUND!")
        break
    print("Found: ", chest)

print()

# 2. Process only valid items
var items = ["sword", "broken", "shield", "broken", "potion"]
print("Processing items...")
for item in items:
    if item == "broken":
        continue
    print("Added to inventory: ", item)
hints: Use continue to skip unwanted items
Use break to stop when you find what you need
